intro: Leptochilus × prolifer, commonly known as the hybrid rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and often covered in a fine layer of pubescence. The flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with four petals arranged in a typical cruciform pattern.
